messages: 32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:40): Is this a good spot to ask for guidance on conventions for HTML5 markup?
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (23:41): I would think so
b22ffeb257defbec378725aa7acca21e (23:41): yussir
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:42): nooooooooooooo a room named #html5 would be the last place to talk about html5 :P
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (23:42): was that your question? ;)

32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:42): I'm curious about the best way to markup a "recommendation" as in one person recommending another. The elements are the Company Name, Person Name, Person Title, the actual text of the recommendation, and so on.

32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:42): I'm pondering a definition list, but also was wondering if there's a microformat for this that exists already with some direction on the actual elements to use.
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:43): what happened to the bot?
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (23:43): hey everybody
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (23:43): what happened to bot-t?
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:43): heh... asking a redundant question?  :)
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (23:43): died i guess, in jquery room too
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (23:43): nooooooo
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (23:43): boooooot-t is the reason i am here
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (23:43): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: is the microformat guy ;)
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:44): has been looking at the microformats site to find something, but there's nothing quite right...
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:44): how about straight-up elements? Definition list, blockquote, unordered list, spans?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:45): yay! greasemonkey got updated for the FF betas
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (23:45): i like how fx people never can update to the latest versions because all plugins stop working
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (23:46): the one thing i miss in berkeley is samovar tea lounge
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:47): not sure what to recommend for the recommendation part
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:48): perhaps a section with the class of "recommendation"
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:48): i wonder if hresume would work
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:48): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: thoughts on the individual entities in the section, e.g. the person, company, etc.?
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:48): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: yah, I was looking at hresume also... /me ponders...
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:50): that may be a good area for a 2nd WordPress plugin....resumes
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:50): is also looking at the section on extensibility on diveintohtmml5 which suggest declaring a "microdata vocabulary"
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:50): e.g.: <section itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Person">
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:53): ooh, after my foray into metaboxes in WordPress posts/pages the past 2 days, it'd be a good chance to add a resume section, instead of a lowly widget
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:53): (not that I use WordPress...)
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:54): damn it, now i've gone thinking again, i already have enough ideas that need completed

32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:57): Hunh... I'm confused. Is this http://www.data-vocabulary.org/ site canonical? Folks use it? Because it does have a vocabulary for Review that would probably work: http://www.data-vocabulary.org/Review/
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:58): But I'm confused about the relationship between formats like hCard and something like: http://www.data-vocabulary.org/Person/
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (23:58): they seem to be overlapping, or competing...?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:59): i'd probably stick to http://microformats.org/ personally
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (23:59): unless they link to a different site, then i'd trust in their reference to it
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (00:01): ah, looks like data-vocabulary.org might be Google, yah?
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:01): it is google
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:01): ?g google microdata, rdfa
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:02): OH SHI
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:02): no worries 47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec i got that typo for you
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:02): http://www.google.com/support/webmasters/bin/answer.py?answer=176035
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (00:03): the world without bot-t is lame
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:03): the world without botty is no world at all
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:03): is in mourning
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (00:04): Okay, so data-vocabulary is Google and those are "microdata" vs. microformats. Any preference in the HTML5 community?
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:04): microdata for me
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:04): you can use microformats in microdata too
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (00:04): (sorry if I'm asking redundant, bot-worthy, questions -- just trying to get my head around the "best practices" that people are actually using.
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:04): i probably mix the two
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:05): http://html5doctor.com/microdata/
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:05): microformats + the html5 stuff coming in
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:05): mmost authoritative
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (00:05): ^
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (00:05): 47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec +1 (thanks)
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (00:05): just what I was looking for...
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:09): doh, firefox doesn't sync addons
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:10): might not hurt to check out he operator addon
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (00:11): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: ah, cool. Good suggestion...

32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (00:14): Is it pretty confusing, however. From the html5doctor site, it certainly makes it seem like microdata and microformats are competitng / overlapping standards.
32b2c92365109b147abecbb839014626 (00:15): reads http://blog.foolip.org/2009/08/23/microformats-vs-rdfa-vs-microdata/
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:16): i'm sure they are competing a bit, but i figure using any of it doesn't hurt youu
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:16): and as one starts becoming the defacto standard, you can easily go in and change your markup
